intro: Hieracium apotropum, commonly known as the devil's bit scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Europe and western Asia and typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and woodland edges. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional remedies. Hieracium apotropum plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
